model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Mentee, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Mentee: Mentor, I'm feeling really lonely in this new city. I don't know anyone yet and I miss my old friends.
Mentor: I understand that starting over can be tough, Mentee. But remember, this is also an opportunity for you to meet new people and make new connections.

[MEMORY]
1. The Mentor reassures Mentee that many students feel the same way and that everyone works at their own pace, understanding that starting over can be tough. 
2. The Mentee has been offered a job and has decided to take the job in the city, hoping to inspire others to join the cause of gender equality and fighting discrimination.
3. The Mentor is supportive and praises the Mentee for their mature decision-making process, believing their work has been influential and that they will continue to make an impact in the world. Mentee agreed to go back to the store to make things right and expressed gratitude for the mentor's advice.
